data.label: ChatOpenAI
data.name: chatOpenAI
data.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputParams.label: Stop Sequence
inputParams.name: stopSequence
inputParams.description: List of stop words to use when generating. Use comma to separate multiple stop words.

inputParams.label: Allow Image Uploads
inputParams.name: allowImageUploads
inputParams.description: Allow image input. Refer to the docs for more details.

inputParams.label: Image Resolution
inputParams.description: This parameter controls the resolution in which the model views the image.
inputParams.name: imageResolution

outputAnchors.name: chatOpenAI
outputAnchors.label: ChatOpenAI
outputAnchors.description: Wrapper around OpenAI large language models that use the Chat endpoint

inputAnchors.label: Chat Model
inputAnchors.name: model
inputAnchors.description: Only compatible with models that are capable of function calling: ChatOpenAI, ChatMistral, ChatAnthropic, ChatGoogleGenerativeAI, ChatVertexAI, GroqChat

inputAnchors.label: Agent Memory
inputAnchors.name: agentMemory
inputAnchors.description: Save the state of the agent

inputAnchors.label: State
inputAnchors.name: state
inputAnchors.description: State is an object that is updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

inputAnchors.label: Input Moderation
inputAnchors.description: Detect text that could generate harmful output and prevent it from being sent to the language model
inputAnchors.name: inputModeration

data.label: Postgres Agent Memory
data.name: postgresAgentMemory
data.description: Memory for agentflow to remember the state of the conversation using Postgres database

outputAnchors.name: postgresAgentMemory
outputAnchors.label: AgentMemory
outputAnchors.description: Memory for agentflow to remember the state of the conversation using Postgres database

data.label: State
data.name: seqState
data.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

tabs.label: Custom State (Table)
tabs.name: stateMemoryUI
tabs.description: Structure for state. By default, state contains "messages" that got updated with each message sent and received.

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
Specify the Key, Operation Type, and Default Value for the state object. The Operation Type can be either "Replace" or "Append".

**Replace**
- Replace the existing value with the new value.
- If the new value is null, the existing value will be retained.

**Append**
- Append the new value to the existing value.
- Default value can be empty or an array. Ex: ["a", "b"]
- Final value is an array.

tabs.label: Custom State (Code)
tabs.name: stateMemoryCode

outputAnchors.name: seqState
outputAnchors.label: State
outputAnchors.description: A centralized state object, updated by nodes in the graph, passing from one node to another

inputParams.label: System Prompt
inputParams.name: systemMessagePrompt
inputParams.default: You are a research assistant who can search for up-to-date info using search engine.

inputParams.label: Prepend Messages History
inputParams.name: messageHistory
inputParams.description: Prepend a list of messages between System Prompt and Human Prompt. This is useful when you want to provide few shot examples

inputParams.label: Conversation History
inputParams.name: conversationHistorySelection

options.label: User Question
options.name: user_question
options.description: Use the user question from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Last Conversation Message
options.name: last_message
options.description: Use the last conversation message from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: All Conversation Messages
options.name: all_messages
options.description: Use all conversation messages from the historical conversation messages as input.

options.label: Empty
options.name: empty
options.description: Do not use any messages from the conversation history. Ensure to use either System Prompt, Human Prompt, or Messages History.

inputParams.description: Select which messages from the conversation history to include in the prompt. The selected messages will be inserted between the System Prompt (if defined) and [Messages History, Human Prompt].

inputParams.label: Human Prompt
inputParams.name: humanMessagePrompt
inputParams.description: This prompt will be added at the end of the messages as human message

inputParams.label: Require Approval
inputParams.name: interrupt
inputParams.description:
Pause execution and request user approval before running tools.
If enabled, the agent will prompt the user with customizable approve/reject options
and will proceed only after approval. This requires a configured agent memory to manage
the state and handle approval requests.
If no tools are invoked, the agent proceeds without interruption.

inputParams.label: Format Prompt Values
inputParams.name: promptValues
inputParams.description: Assign values to the prompt variables. You can also use $flow.state.<variable-name> to get the state value

inputParams.label: Approval Prompt
inputParams.name: approvalPrompt
inputParams.description: Prompt for approval. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled
inputParams.default: You are about to execute tool: {tools}. Ask if user want to proceed

inputParams.label: Approve Button Text
inputParams.name: approveButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for approve button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

inputParams.label: Reject Button Text
inputParams.name: rejectButtonText
inputParams.description: Text for reject button. Only applicable if "Require Approval" is enabled

tabs.label: Update State (Table)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryUI

hint.label: How to use
hint.value:
1. Key and value pair to be updated. For example: if you have the following State:
    | Key       | Operation     | Default Value     |
    |-----------|---------------|-------------------|
    | user      | Replace       |                   |

    You can update the "user" value with the following:
    | Key       | Value     |
    |-----------|-----------|
    | user      | john doe  |

2. If you want to use the Agent's output as the value to update state, it is available as available as `$flow.output` with the following structure:
    ```json
    {
        "content": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
        "usedTools": [
            {
                "tool": "tool-name",
                "toolInput": "{foo: var}",
                "toolOutput": "This is the tool's output"
            }
        ],
        "sourceDocuments": [
            {
                "pageContent": "This is the page content",
                "metadata": "{foo: var}"
            }
        ]
    }
    ```

    For example, if the `toolOutput` is the value you want to update the state with, you can do the following:
    | Key       | Value                                     |
    |-----------|-------------------------------------------|
    | user      | `$flow.output.usedTools[0].toolOutput`  |

3. You can get default flow config, including the current "state":
    - `$flow.sessionId`
    - `$flow.chatId`
    - `$flow.chatflowId`
    - `$flow.input`
    - `$flow.state`

4. You can get custom variables: `$vars.<variable-name>`

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values

tabs.label: Update State (Code)
tabs.name: updateStateMemoryCode

hint.label: How to use

tabs.description: This is only applicable when you have a custom State at the START node. After agent execution, you might want to update the State values. Must return an object representing the state

data.label: Code Interpreter by E2B
data.name: codeInterpreterE2B
data.description: Execute code in a sandbox environment

inputParams.label: Tool Name
inputParams.name: toolName
inputParams.description: Specify the name of the tool

inputParams.label: Tool Description
inputParams.name: toolDesc
inputParams.description: Specify the description of the tool
inputParams.default: Evaluates python code in a sandbox environment. The environment is long running and exists across multiple executions. You must send the whole script every time and print your outputs. Script should be pure python code that can be evaluated. It should be in python format NOT markdown. The code should NOT be wrapped in backticks. All python packages including requests, matplotlib, scipy, numpy, pandas, etc are available. Create and display chart using "plt.show()".

inputs.toolDesc: Evaluates python code in a sandbox environment. The environment is long running and exists across multiple executions. You must send the whole script every time and print your outputs. Script should be pure python code that can be evaluated. It should be in python format NOT markdown. The code should NOT be wrapped in backticks. All python packages including requests, matplotlib, scipy, numpy, pandas, etc are available. Create and display chart using "plt.show()".

outputAnchors.name: codeInterpreterE2B
outputAnchors.label: CodeInterpreter
outputAnchors.description: Execute code in a sandbox environment
